channel.title: Daily Fantasy Sports Australia
channel.description: Recent content on Daily Fantasy Sports Australia

item.title: 2022 AFL Preseason Fantasy Stats
item.description: We’ve collated all the important stats for the 2022 AAMI Community Series to help you prepare your AFL Fantasy Team for season 2022. We’ll update these regularly as games finish so come back throughout the weekend and get updated stats. Stats can be downloaded here in csv form. GLOSSARY Salary: starting AFL Fantasy Salary Position: starting AFL Fantasy Positions K -> G: standard AFL stats (e.g. kicks, marks, handballs…….

item.title: AFLW Extended Stats
item.description: The AFLW season has kicked off for 2022 and people are starting to get interested in AFLW Fantasy. Moreira’s Magic have released a great product that everyone should be getting behind aflwfantasy.com.au. We don’t envisage providing data tools at this stage but to do our little part in building this community we’ve collated the advanced stats for Round 1 of the AFLW season and made them downloadable here.

item.title: trial-iframe
item.description: What is Value? A popular way to try normalise player performance in the Fantasy Sports community is to define it in terms of a multiple of their salary. For example, if Tom Mitchell is priced at $15,000 and scores 105 fantasy points then he’s deemed to have returned 7.00x his salary, e.g. (105 / 15,000) * 1000 = 7.00x. This common strategy gives coaches the ability to compare players across a range of salaries and make a decision on who they think is the best value play for their lineup.

item.title: Can You Be Profitable Playing AFL DFS?
item.description: I’m confident in saying that 99% of people who read this blog post have at some point dreamt of turning their AFL DFS hobby into a full time income stream. How practical though is that dream in the current landscape? Draftkings and Fanduel offer up eye-watering prizes for those playing US sports but AFL tournaments on Draftstars rarely offer up more than $75,000 prize pools with first place usually taking home less than $10,000.

item.title: Player Clustering - Advanced Defence v Position
item.description: Defence v Position Defence vs Position (or DVP) is a common tool used throughout the Fantasy Sports Industry. The tool has varying levels of importance depending on which sport you are playing. Sports like NBA or NFL lend themselves very well to DVP as there are specific one-on-one matchups that are predictable from one game to the next and player’s roles are highly consistent.

item.title: Defining Draftstars Player Value
item.description: What is Value? A popular way to try normalise player performance in the Fantasy Sports community is to define it in terms of a multiple of their salary. For example, if Tom Mitchell is priced at $15,000 and scores 105 fantasy points then he’s deemed to have returned 7.00x his salary, e.g. (105 / 15,000) * 1000 = 7.00x. This common strategy gives coaches the ability to compare players across a range of salaries and make a decision on who they think is the best value play for their lineup.

item.title: AFL Research Tool (Premium)
item.description: IF YOU ARE A CURRENT MEMBER CLICK HERE TO SIGN IN To become a successful daily fantasy player it’s important to analyse your own performance but also to dig deep into what your opponents are doing. The best players spend a lot hours analysing their opponents play to get an understanding of how they construct their lineups. The ability to do this level of research has to date only been accessible to those with the programming knowledge to build their own applications.

item.title: Contact
item.description: Get in Touch with Daily Fantasy Sports Australia If you want to get in touch, the best way is to contact us on Twitter at @DFSAustralia.

item.title: Defense vs Position
item.description: iframe { min-width: 100%; } Defense vs Position (DVP) is shown in terms of fantasy points conceded above (+) or below (-) a players average. For example, a DVP of +10.0 would indicate that that team allows an opposing player to score 10 points above their season average. Positions in the DVP table have been classified by using a clustering algorithm similar to that discussed here. Refer to the glossary below for further explanation of each position.

item.title: Download AFL Game Logs
item.description: Wanting to get your hands on AFL game logs to run your own analysis? We’ve opened up access to our database and for a small fee of $10 you can download player game logs from the start of the 2021 season onwards. Stats will be downloaded in a simple csv format, example of output shown below. $10 gives you access to the database for one calendar year (until December 31st 2022).

item.title: Draftstars - Golfer Cuts
Draftstars Historical Tournaments
item.description: iframe { min-width: 100%; } This database of historical tournaments is a comprehensive list of all Draftstars contests dating back to September 2020. The database is updated daily to include new contests and report the winners. The original Draftstars tournament page can be accessed by clicking on the respective tournament name. Optimal lineups are available for completed AFL contests (other sports will follow in future) by clicking on the optimal lineup hyperlink.

item.title: Draftstars Profit Tracker
item.description: iframe { min-width: 100%; } To analyse your performance using this Profit Tracker you need to download your history file (in csv format) direct from Draftstars. This can then be uploaded into the tool and your results will be broken down for you to review. The maximum file size that can be uploaded into the application is 20MB. Its recommended that you do not modify the csv file before uploading, the application may not be able to successfully read the data if columns have been modified.

item.title: Draftstars Slate Analysis
item.description: iframe { min-width: 100%; } Click Here to enter full screen mode GLOSSARY * Next Match: details of next premiership season matchup * Last 5: individual fantasy scores over the last 5 rounds * Averages: season averages or form averages over last 3, 10, 20 games (excluding games with less than 50% TOG) * Last 20 Games: standard deviation, max and min fantasy scores over last 20 games (excluding games with less than 50% TOG)

item.title: NBA With Without Player Trends
item.description: iframe { min-width: 100%; } This application summarises player game performance when a selected teammate has suited up versus when they have not. Where players have been traded mid-season it’s recommended that the user give more consideration to the player’s specific game logs to ensure the trends aren’t skewed by performances where the player was no longer rostered by that team. iFrameResize({ heightCalculationMethod: 'taggedElement' });

item.title: Support Us
item.description: Daily Fantasy Sports Australia provide free statistical analysis and data tools for both season long and daily fantasy players. Many hours have gone into developing the website and maintaining the content for the benefit of the fantasy community. If you use our product or we’ve helped you win money in a DFS tournament or sports bet consider supporting us by buying us a coffee. Supporting us helps us to continue to provide the same level of content in the future.

item.title: Tools
item.description: AFL - DETAILED PLAYER AND TEAM STATS Detailed Player and Team Stats, including: Player Game Logs Player Splits Team Fantasy Scores For/Against Advanced Player Tables including Centre Bounce Attendances Player Performance With/Without Team Mates Points Conceded by Position Detailed Ruck Analysis including Ruck Contests Attended Match-Up History Stats from 2016 to Present AFL - DRAFTSTARS SLATE BUILDER Need help building a winning Draftstars Side? This application includes all the player stats you’ll need including up to date team lineup status to ensure you don’t get caught out by that late change.
